summary:
Kefir: The Cultured Dairy Beverage Should Be Drinking

 Confused about the buzz around dairy and whether you should consume it...
caption:
Kefir: The Cultured Dairy Beverage Should Be Drinking

Confused about the buzz around dairy and whether you should consume it or not? With concerns about lactose intolerance and claims that dairy can increase inflammation, it’s no wonder people are advocating against it. But it’s not always so black and white – in fact, cultured (or fermented) dairy …

Read more: http://lifewaykefir.com/kefir-the-cultured-dairy-beverage-should-be-drinking/

summary: Adding heavy rack pulls to nsuns CAP3. via /r/Fitness
title: Adding heavy rack pulls to nsuns CAP3. via /r/Fitness
body:
Relatively easy question, i’m running nsuns CAP3, and i’m questioning where the best day would be to add heavy rack pulls.

I’m thinking about switching every other week with deficit deadlifts, but I kinda want that 2x DL frequency. program!

Would appreciate simple feedback greatly!



Submitted September 13, 2018 at 06:14AM by myrvoll
via reddit https://ift.tt/2N9Tx6V

summary: HCSM News ~ Ottawa proposes $100M settlement for disabled vets over clawback of benefits
title: HCSM News ~ Ottawa proposes $100M settlement for disabled vets over clawback of benefits
body:
Ottawa has agreed to pay $100 million to settle a four-year legal battle with disabled veterans who had launched a class-action lawsuit after some of their financial benefits were clawed back.



Read more from CBC https://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/veterans-settlement-oreagan-1.4821653?cmp=rss

reblog.comment:

Read more from CBC https://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/veterans-settlement-oreagan-1.4821653?cmp=rss

blog.description: Hi! I'm Emma, a 20 year old college student studying nutrition but learning how to be a good human. I love running, sports, mental health, my family and my friends. Everyday is a new lesson for me. Check out some of my personal posts here or check out some of my best eats. Feel free to ask me anything :)

summary: HCSM News ~ Man with autism spends 8 days in Calgary ER — mostly in isolation — but never admitted
title: HCSM News ~ Man with autism spends 8 days in Calgary ER — mostly in isolation — but never admitted
body:
Harold Lovell spent a week in an isolated room at a Calgary hospital emergency department — without a toothbrush or a change of clothes — waiting for a bed to receive mental health treatment. He didn’t get it.



Read more from CBC https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/calgary/man-with-autism-calgary-emergency-1.4821148?cmp=rss

summary: I had to resort to using the treadmill for cardio this morning because I pulled my quad during my hard cardio day yesterday. It...
body:
I had to resort to using the treadmill for cardio this morning because I pulled my quad during my hard cardio day yesterday. It created a half-ass day at the gym. I’m trying to tell myself that half-ass workouts are better than no workouts but I still feel defeated.

😪🖕🏻

reblog.comment:

summary: Replacing exercises in 5/3/1 for beginners training via /r/Fitness
title: Replacing exercises in 5/3/1 for beginners training via /r/Fitness
body:
A little background. I’m following the 5/3/1 training for beginners from the wiki for about 3 months. I’m really bored of doing squats, I think 2 times a week it’s too much. Could you recommend me other exercises that will replace the squat day with something for the upper body instead? Thanks.



Submitted September 13, 2018 at 05:32AM by monoarc
via reddit https://ift.tt/2QrYp5C
